name: The Marcel at Gramercy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given the prices and size of rooms in NY the Marcel surprised us with a relatively spacious room and affordable prices. The location of the hotel is excellent in that it is in between Soho and uptown,has a number of affordable restaurants nearby and the subway is very close. The rooms were clean and the beds comfy. The staff were helpful especially the day we left where they organised a town car to pick us up for a very early flight which was cheaper than a cab and much nicer with less hassle. If you are looking for an afforable option in New York that is clean and above average without breaking the bank then this should fit the bill. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: A good find in New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at the Marcel and found the staff very helpful and check in was quick. We were given a room on the 2nd floor 215 I think, and on first impression the room was small but nice with a decent bathroom, however there was an annoying whirring noise coming from outside - I think it was the air con or the elevator machinary? Anyway I we thought that the noise would be too unbearable and so went to reception to see if we could change, bearing in mind the hotel was very busy, it was no trouble at all to change rooms. We moved to a room on the 9th floor to the side of the hotel which was much quieter again the room was small but lovely inside - comfy bed , vey clean and the shower in the bathroom was huge with a normal shower head and a second 'rain effect' shower head. There is free coffee and internet on the 10th floor with a lovely roof terrace also - luckily the weather was great when we were there so we could actually use it to chill out.
reviews.title: surprised in a good way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loads of bars and nice resturants in local area - off the tourist trap, 10min to maddison square garden about 15- 20min walk and you are in times square.
reviews.title: Great value, friendly helpful staff. Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice boutique style hotel in a quiet area
reviews.title: Chic, super-central hotel at an unbeatable price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a weekend in New York. We got an amazing deal through Quickbook with The Marcel and although I was a bit nervous having read the reviews here, it was too good to turn down.
reviews.title: great stay for a great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 6 nights at the end of April.
reviews.title: Good location, nice hotel & big rooms - bargain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both room and common areas were nice and clean, the hotel was redecorated in 2007.
reviews.title: Great Value Hotel in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is very, very good, some 5-7 minutes stroll to the nearest subway station. And the Flatiron buiding one block further away. The area of Gramercy and Flatiron houses lots of restaurants and bars - both high end (Michelin rated) and more "common"
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 609 (superior room) which is next to the elevator (but no noise from it what so ever). The room was big (very big for NYC) and facing the corner of 3rd and 24th.
reviews.title: It's a lottery! Don't stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aircondition worked perfectly, no complaints - NY enjoyed som very hot days when we stayed there, temperature above 30 degrees (centigrade).
reviews.title: Best value for money in New York
Great little hotel
reviews.text: Nice little boutique hotel on east side of Manhattan. Clean and cool with rooftop observation deck and coffee bar. They responded promptly anytime I called. The only bad thing about it was I could hear the street noise even though we were on floor 7.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I travel to NYC fairly often (for business and for fun), but this time I wanted to stay a little farther from the overly touristy areas. The neighborhood the Marcel at Gramercy is in is EXACTLY what I was looking for... I loved it. Not too touristy, but of course plenty of great neighborhood restaurants, etc. Closest subway stop (the 6) is just a short walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Loved the Marcel at Gramercy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I absolutely loved my room. I see some other reviewers have complained that the rooms here were small -- yes, it's a little small, but it's an average NYC-size room. I've actually stayed in several much smaller (yet more expensive) hotel rooms. If you're traveling to NYC, you have to skew your idea of ideal room size. And I'm not sure if all rooms/floors in the Marcel are like mine, but I had an awesome high ceiling. I think I was on the 5th floor? Anyway, I loved the design of the room too. It was beautiful and it was CLEAN. No complaints there.
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice but small rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't have any communication with the staff beyond checking in, checking out, and checking my bag for a few hours after checkout. Everyone I talked to was very nice, very polite. Again, no complaints.
reviews.title: Decent hotel for decent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I got a great deal on this room for a January weekend. I'm interested to see what the rates will be during the spring and summer. The Marcel at Gramercy is definitely a new addition to my Go-To NYC hotels list. Can't wait to stay here again!
reviews.title: Poor Managing, Where is my money?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The charming lobby is nothing like what you will find in your tinny 10x10 rooms. The heater was broken and I called the front desk several times to fix it and no one ever come up. The hotel does not have room service. The corridor are tinny and very noise because of the proximity of all doors. The room is so little that as you open the door you are on top of the bed and I am not making any joking about this! no outlets inside the room except in the bathroom. One of the front desk staff was friendly and helpful in giving information about the city, but other then that the quality of the rooms are very poor. NY does have better choice for the price. Stay away.
reviews.title: Stay away! Hotel is not ready for guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really don't know where to start. Checking in was a breeze! Stayed on the sixth floor. Our room was spectacular. The size was great in comparison to other rooms in New York. The staff were great. No complaints at all. We can't wait to return.
reviews.title: One of the best Hotels I've stayed in
Check your bill carefully
reviews.text: Room was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. It's a good thing I was a solo traveler, because it would have been a very tight squeeze with 2. Two people could not walk down the hallway together. Room was clean. There was no apparent way to change the temperature, and you could feel the cold air coming in all around the window if you stood near it. At check-out, the front desk and I confirmed there were no additional charges but when I got home there were charges. I called the hotel and they told me they charged me for breakfast and minibar items, neither of which I had at any point during my stay. I disputed the charge and they did say they would take them off right away (good) because they have issues billing the wrong room a lot (? VERY bad).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel suited my needs for the very short time I was there, but I wouldn't be able to stay here for an extended period of time (more than 1-2 days) due to the lack of space. Stay somewhere else if you want space and amenities.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel and Convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel was a nice suprise! We had heard that New York was very expensive to stay in and you would end up in a horrible hotel for the money we were willing to spend. The room was small but immaculate. The staff were very professional and friendly and made us feel very comfortable. The location is excellent for sightseeing and eating out. We went to a number of local restaurants and they were all lovely!
reviews.title: Such a bad experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel characterizes itself as a boutique hotel in mid town. The location is excellent and the rooms are on the small side, but pass-able size-wise. However, rooms only have single pane windows and if you happen to be on the side of the hotel facing the street, you will be up all night listening to the sounds of the city that never sleeps.
reviews.title: Not Worth It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rooms also do not have central air. Instead there is one of those wall unit combo heater/air conditioner. The heating/ac unit in my room did not work well and it made so much noise (a constant grinding noise) that it actually drowned out the car noise from the streets.
reviews.title: I don't recommend staying here - especially with kids!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room rates here lower here than other hotels, but if you want any restful sleep, avoid this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent from start to finish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Marcel is a very nicely decorated hotel. That's the nicest thing I can say about it!
reviews.title: Clean, Modern, Safe and recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its very cold, lacks charm or anything else to make it attractive or worth the $200+/night rates.
reviews.title: Very Good, but beware!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed for three nights with 20+ colleagues. They are typically a picky group, but I heard no complaints - so that says a lot. Spent much time in the adjoining wine bar, everyone enjoyed and the food/service was excellent. Rooms were clean/modern. I read reviews about the lack of horizontal surfaces for storage, but I didn't have an issue. Sink is very shallow (form over function) but it looked cool. Wireless internet was a bit wonky. I had an upper room facing 24th street (at the end of the hall) and it was quiet as long as the air conditioner was running. Comfortable bedding. Friendly staff. Conference/Bfast room has great view and nice deck.
reviews.title: Nice Stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010
reviews.text: We were unsure about the location when we made the reservation, but really loved it. Rooms are simple, the bed was comfortable and bathroom clean. The breakfast was basic-$12. There is also a nice deck off of the 10th floor breakfast room. We did not go to the bar in the building no were we disturbed by the noise. All of the employees we interacted with were friendly.
reviews.title: We were unsure about the location when we...
great hotel
reviews.text: great hotel, small room but really clean (508), the view from the roof is amazing.Staff very friendly....there is no doubt that we ll stay there for our next trip in New York.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were first in NY during our honeymoon and everything was fantastic, Fantastic, wanderfull, not only because we were in a honeymoon!
reviews.title: FANTASTIC
superb hotel...!!! awesome crew...!!!
reviews.text: The hotel has a nice terrace were you could have a breakfast and see the Empire. The room was nr. 508 at the 5 foor... very clean and fashion... with the I-Pod station and in the bathroom you have everything yoy need!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel was renovating while we stayed there but had not advised us of this. The noise and the mess was unbearable and started at very early hours. The room was unbelievably small, it couldn't even accomodate two suitcases so we had to leave one in the bathroom which was very inconvenient. We asked for a new room but the rooms that were not being renovated were full so they could not move us. We said we would look for other hotels but they informed us as we had booked in advance they would not refund our money.
reviews.title: What a dump!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was closed during our entire stay (which we were also not told about)and the cappucino bar with complimentary coffees and pastries was just a coffee machine in the lobby which the staff wouldn't show us how to work. The elevator was taken up with the builders so most patrons used the stairs. Staff were very unfriendly and at some times borderline rude. The room was cleaned once in the 6 nights we were there. Although as the room was so tiny we tried not to spend any time there so it was more the mess outside of the room that concerned us. There were building supplies left in corridors, immediately outside of our room, the elevator and all over the common areas. The staff even refused to call us a taxi to the airport-apparently "they just don't do that"
reviews.title: Great stay at the Marcel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would avoid this hotel at all costs, even factoring out the discomfort caused by the renovations, the service was appalling, the rooms tiny and noisy and the price was far far far too expensive for this standard. I would prefer a travelodge or hojo's to the marcel
reviews.title: The only hotel to stay at in NY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: We got a crazy deal through quikbook - something under $80, seriously. Given the price I was a little nervous, but the hotel was lovely. The room we had was on the 5th floor, and was very small. But it was spotless, and very well appointed. The bed was comfortable, the room was beautifully decorated, and the bathroom was great. Nice desk, ipod clock next to the bed, flat screen tv. The heating/AC unit was a little wonky, but overall I was thrilled with the whole place, especially given the price.
reviews.title: Very hip!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There aren't many hotels which I can say that will make me want to return to a city as much the Marcel.
reviews.title: Amazing Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed there with my 11-year-old son, and we thought it was a great bargain. The rooms are tiny, it's true, but they were spotlessly clean. The 10th-floor patio/lounge was a nice place to relax at the end of a busy day. You can chill on a lounge chair, reading the New York Times, and look up from your paper to see the Empire State Building just across the way. The staff is super-friendly, although not as knowledgeable on subway directions as we might have hoped. The neighborhood is lovely, very low-key, but with plenty of bakeries, diners, etc, in walking distance. We hope to stay there again on our next trip,
reviews.title: Cool hotel at a reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was planning a mid week surprise for my girlfriend as we were celebrating our one year anniversary.
reviews.title: Loved Everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I wanted to get her out of the apartment and find a swanky hotel that wouldn't completely break the bank so after much research I booked The Marcel - and I'm so happy I did.
reviews.title: Amazing staff, amazing location, amazing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Upon check-in they asked me if I was there for a special occasion and I mentioned the anniversary. Instantly, the hotel manager jumped in, upgraded us to a corner room; which was spectacular, gave us breakfast both mornings and had a bottle of champagne sent up to us.
reviews.title: My First Time In the BIG APPLE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every single member of the staff greeted us with a smile from the door man to the maintenance man.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!
Won't return--claustrophobic
reviews.text: I travel for a living and used to live in Manhattan, know that to begin. This hotel was, in a word, suffocating. They did not have the bed size I had reserved (queen) and instead gave me a tiny room with a full (if that) bed and no window. When I asked for a change, the desk clerk tried to tell me This is the way it is in NYC." I then got an even smaller room (no closet) but at least it had a window. The halls are also cramped and the overall feeling was claustrophobic. One of the few hotels in NYC I will not visit again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the marcel in early july for a mini family get away and boy wasnt It amazing! The staff made us feel right at home upon our arrival and gave us amazing resturant suggestions throughout our stay! As for the rooms they were decent sized for a nyc hotel cant complain! Deff will be returning to the Marcel.
reviews.title: special thanks to the Marcel staff!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff were amazingly friendly and helpful, we especially appreciated the fact the doorman recommended the black car service to take us to the airport at the end of our stay. The hotel room was small, but clean, and we thought the roof top lounge was great for planning the day ahead with fantastic views. The only downside to the room on the second floor was the fact that it was above a noisy bar/restuarant and the air conditioning unit was extremely loud. Luckily we were tired enough most nights to sleep through it.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location but noisy air con

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Location was also very good, we found some really nice bars nearby and it was walking distance to Empire State Building.
reviews.title: Terrible room at the Marcel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was given a room which faced another building or maybe it faced into the restaurant next door. A/C worked terribly and window would not open...possibly due to the loud compressor just outside the window. Room was extremely tiny and they try to call this tiny table a desk which I couldn't even sit at. I had to pull the damn thing away from the wall and do work or eat from the edge of the bed.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for decent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights at The Marcel and overall had a very good stay. We arrived early and were made to feel very welcome by the front desk staff, who upgraded us from a standard to a double queen, given our party of 2 adults + 2 children.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel with friendly staff in nice, non touristy area
Excellent stay in a great hotel
reviews.text: When we arrived in the room, however, we noticed that it was on the same level as and looked directly onto a huge air-conditioning unit in a dark shaft.The prospect of a sleepless night, or even 5, prompted me to ask the front desk if any others were available. As pleasant and helpful as when we first arrived, they swiftly found us a room on the ninth floor with a view of the Empire State Building instead!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was spotless, with a kind of funky zebra theme. Though some of the furniture was scratched ( more or less inevitable when people have luggage) and the tiling in the bathroom suggested rushed if not amateur workmanship, we had a very comfortable stay, with absolutely no noise issues whatsoever.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Others have mentioned the small rooms, but frankly you're not in NYC to stay in your hotel and watch TV.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Unfortunately Very Popular!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate once at the adjoining restaurant : good service and tasty Italian food. For breakfast we just ate elsewhere, mainly at Starbucks to get a decent coffee. The neighbourhood has plenty of informal dining options. Head down 3rd instead of up.
reviews.title: Lovely staff, little bit noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Marcel at Gramercy for 3 nights in March 2010. The rooms and other hotel areas are decorated nicely and looked very up to date. Our room was smaller than expected, although not the smallest, according to the floor map hanging by the elevators. It was nice for a short stay, but I would need more space for a longer stay. There was no closet to hang clothes (just a rack on the wall where you could hang a jacket or two). There was an iron, but no ironing board (as there is no room to stand one up) so I had to iron my clothes on the bed. We were on the 6th floor and found there was noticeable street noise but I slept fine with ear plugs. The bed was not particularly comfortable - this is probably the one thing that really bothered me. The location of the hotel is good - subway stations are within a 5 minute walk and there are lots of places to eat in the area. We made reservations directly on the hotel website and the price we paid was very reasonable. Other hotels we looked at were 3 or 4 times the cost. There is somewhat of a view of the Empire State Building from the 10th floor lounge, but I'm not sure if there are any rooms that offer a view. Although we enjoyed our stay, the next time we're in New York, we will probably pay a little more and stay somewhere that offers a little more space and a more comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Decent hotel - good for a short stay.
Great hotel in superb location
reviews.text: The Marcel is located in a great part of New York. You can walk to Union Square, Washington Square, the flat iron building, Nolita, etc and the subway is very close. This is a funky, modern hotel that is well run and has a stylish lobby and rooms. Yes, the rooms are small, but this is New York, and the Marcel is fantastic value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here for a few nights during the "blizzard" at the begining of February. The staff was so helpful, one of the front desk staff even offered to take my post cards to the post office himself, as they didnt have Canadian stamps! And my friends already have their postcards so he must have done it right away. Every time I exited the elevator, I was greeted with a big smile, as well as every time I returned to the hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay, will be returning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms are small, but it's New York. By the floor plan on the back of the door, I did have the smallest room on the floor, but I didnt mind. There was a big desk that I was able to put my things on, and a small shelf that wrapped around the mirror of the bathroom that I could store my makeup on. The closet was a fair size, way too big for the amount of things I had. And the beds.. Ohhh the beds were SO comfy! The sheets were nice and soft and the pillows were plush and heavenly. I didnt hear a single noise coming from outside either. The only downside that I found was not being able to open the window. I get hot easily, and the AC was somewhat hard to figure out, but anyone with half a brain could do it. The bathtub was suprisingly large, I had a bath and it was considerably larger then my apartment sized bathtub at home- which was shocking.
reviews.title: Dreadful stay. For so many reasons.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I've already recommended this hotel to several people, and have booked again for this summer. I'm so excited to return, as this hotel was super funky, comfortable and had a great location. If you dont want the smallest room on the floor, ask not to have room 201, 301, 401 etc.
reviews.title: Stylish, small Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel was beautiful and we would love to go back. It was very clean and conveniently located to a lot of NY attractions. The staff was also very sweet, helpful and accommodating
reviews.title: We loved this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: As an interior designer for luxury hospitality projects I am always so excited to stay at properties that are just above-and-beyond... and The Marcel at Gramercy did just that! Everything about the hotel, from location to service to price was outstanding. The amazing flexibility of staff-especially Raul Dupless, who does anything at anytime of day, made my business stay extremely stress-free and enjoyable! Plus - the restaurant next door has the absolute best pasta and prices in town! I was there 5 nights and it truly felt like a second home. Thank you to the entire hotel team for such an amazing experience!
reviews.title: Amazing Service - Like a 2nd Home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is a nice, clean hotel in the Gramercy area of Manhattan - close to subway, restaurants. Staff is very friendly and helpful and car service is available to airport. Room was very clean, modern and quiet, and there is a very nice patio on top roof level with a beautiful view of New York skyline. The only suggestion would be to have coffee maker in the room, and have the continental breakfast included in the cost of the room. Would definitely return to this charming hotel.
reviews.title: Would return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, I must say EVERYONE of the workers is REALLY nice and helpful. But... when we got to our room... picture this: a double bed, two night-tables and the only place left to leave our suitcases was the floor on one of the sides of the bed ( the other one was not wide enough) and that was it as for space. Second part of the story: the air conditioning was VERY loud all the time and, not happy with that, in the middle of the night it started making funny noises so we switched it off but we nearly suffocated so we had to switch it on again.
reviews.title: Very nice workers but terribly noisy air conditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The next morning we asked for a change of room: we got more space but, since the air conditioning was as loud as in the other room, we could switch it off and breathe but then the noise came from outside. We were on the fifth floor but we felt as if the bed was on the pavement; we could hear EVERY single sound from the street (and there are a lot of sounds/ noises in NY streets)
reviews.title: Love this great find so much going back

description: Our perfect location in historic Gramercy District offers easy access to public transportation and major airports. Within arms reach are the hip neighborhoods of the East Village and Lower East Side, Madison and Fifth Avenue shopping, Baruch College, the Empire State and Flatiron buildings, and Union Square. Midtown, Soho, Greenwich Village and Chelsea areas are just a short walk away.
